intro: Baphia megaphylla, commonly known as the large-leaf baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by elongated pods containing seeds. Baphia megaphylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverine areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
